body.p: “The mulgedium in that swamp is very abundant and a very stately plant “,” so erect and soldier-like “,” in large companies “,” rising above all else “,” with its very regular long “,” sharp “,” elliptic head and bluish-white flowers.”
PE 11, pg. 463 / 23 April-6 September 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:27 / T vol. # XXI / PDF # XIV / JVIII & JIX
